p: A case-control study carried out during the French Polynesia ZIKV outbreak in 2013â€“2014 was the first to demonstrate an association between ZIKV and a large increase in the incidence of GBS [ 7]. Subsequently, ZIKV was introduced to South and Central America where excess reports of GBS were also reported in ZIKV-affected areas, and where DENV and CHIKV were already endemic [ 8, 9]. In Mexico, the first cases of ZIKV were reported in late 2015 [ 10, 11]. In this study, we assessed whether post-outbreak endemic circulation of ZIKV in Northeastern Mexico was associated with the development of GBS.
